intro: Priestleya reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed priestleya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and usually pale green or yellowish in color. Priestleya reflexa is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
